data.title: Find the Treasure, Pirate edition
data.statement:
You are a pirate and you need to get to the treasure ({{P}} is you, {{T}} is the treasure).
However you cannot swim and you don't have a boat, so the treasure needs to be on your current island.
The map is given as a matrix of size [[n]] * [[w]].
{{ . }} represents the sea and {{x}} represents the land, you and the treasure are always supposed to be on a cell of land.
you can only walk up,down,left,right and it takes you one minute to walk to a neighbouring cell on the map.
You need to print {{hurray!!}} followed by a space and the minimum number of minutes needed to get to the treasure. Or just print {{arghhh!}} if the treasure is not on your island.

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int w:int
loop n read l:string(w)
write answer
data.inputDescription: <<line 1:>> two integers [[n]] for the number of rows and [[w]] for the number of columns of the matrix
data.outputDescription:
{{hurray!!}} followed by a space and the time required if the treasure is reachable
{{arghhh!}} if the treasure is unreachable

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are a pirate and you need to get to the treasure (P is you, T is the treasure).
However you cannot swim and you don't have a boat, so the treasure needs to be on your current island.
The map is given as a matrix of size n * w.
. represents the sea and x represents the land, you and the treasure are always supposed to be on a cell of land.
you can only walk up,down,left,right and it takes you one minute to walk to a neighbouring cell on the map.
You need to print hurray!! followed by a space and the minimum number of minutes needed to get to the treasure. Or just print arghhh! if the treasure is not on your island.
Input
line 1: two integers n for the number of rows and w for the number of columns of the matrix
Output
hurray!! followed by a space and the time required if the treasure is reachable
arghhh! if the treasure is unreachable
Constraints
1<=n<=40
1<=w<=40
Example
Input
3 3
...
.PT
...
Output
hurray!! 1
